Types of Sri Lanka Virtual Phone Numbers Available

The telecom industry can be confusing, so let’s answer some common questions first. There are many different terms that providers around the world may use when referring to virtual phone numbers in Sri Lanka, including:

Sri Lanka VoIP numbers

Sri Lanka SIP numbers

Sri Lanka IP numbers

All those terms refer to toll free or local phone numbers in Sri Lanka. What’s the difference between them?

Differences Between Toll Free and Local VoIP Numbers in Sri Lanka

Toll free numbers in Sri Lanka are 8 or 9 digit business phone lines that don't cost the caller anything to dial them. They are easily recognized by their area code. The most common toll free area code in Sri Lanka is +94-120. Toll free phone lines in Sri Lanka are also known as free-dial or freephone numbers.

Local virtual numbers in Sri Lanka are 8 or 9 digits long and have an area code associated with a specific city or region. They are also known as Sri Lanka DID numbers or geographic numbers. When dialing these numbers, callers will only be charged the same rate as they pay when making a call to any other local phone number, even if their call is being answered by someone in another country. Popular local phone numbers in Sri Lanka include Kandy and Galle.
